info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 06 at 6:35PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS AND SLIPPERY CONDITIONS POSSIBLE IN THE NORTH CAROLINA MOUNTAINS OVERNIGHT INTO SUNDAY... Scattered to numerous snow showers will develop across the southern Appalachians starting late this evening and increasing in coverage overnight into Sunday morning. Locations above 3000 feet close to the Tennessee and North Carolina border could see accumulations up to an inch by Sunday morning. Locally higher amounts could occur, with 2 to 4 inches possible at higher ridge tops at and above 5000 feet. The snow showers will slowly taper off through late Sunday afternoon. Temperatures falling below the freezing mark overnight into Sunday morning may create slippery road conditions at times. If you are traveling in the Tennessee border counties of the North Carolina mountains during this period, use extra caution and watch out for black ice or snow covered roadways.
